news_header: Typhoon Kong-rey hit eastern Taiwan, causing injuries, evacuations, and widespread cancellations.
news_text: Typhoon Kong-rey made landfall in eastern Taiwan, bringing heavy rain and strong winds. The storm has led to injuries, tree damage, and mudslides. Taiwan has declared a day off, canceled flights, and closed financial markets in anticipation of the strongest storm in 30 years. With winds over 250 km/h, it remains a Category 4 hurricane. Rainfall of up to 1.2 meters is expected, and 36,000 troops are on standby for rescue efforts. Evacuations have occurred in high-risk areas, and nearly 300 international flights have been canceled.
